subject: p17897339
History: -year-old female with altered mental status and wheezing on examination. Patient unable to breath-hold appropriately.
Findings: Left basilar opacities likely represent subsegmental atelectasis. The lung volumes are low but otherwise clear. There is no pneumothorax. No vascular congestion or large pleural effusions are evident. Cardiomediastinal and hilar contours are within normal limits. The colon is distended below the left hemidiaphragm.
Impression: Left basilar atelectasis. No consolidation, edema or pleural effusions.
